properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 10:17PM EST until February 7 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service Blacksburg Va has issued
a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...

Pigg River Near Pigg R Nr Sandy Level affecting Pittsylvania County


Widespread rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches, with locally higher amounts
have been observed across the lower Roanoke River basin since early
Thursday morning. Runoff from this rainfall will continue to
collect in the Roanoke River, resulting in minor flooding.

The National Weather Service in Blacksburg Va has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Pigg River Near Sandy Level
* from early this morning until this afternoon
* At 10 PM tonight the stage was 15.1 feet.
* Flood Stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring.
* The river will continue rising to near 15.9 feet early Friday morning,
and will fall back below flood stage late Friday morning.
* Impact...at 16.0 feet...Pigg River Rd. (Route 771) closed due to
backup flooding along Fryingpan Creek upstream from Toshes Bridge.
* Flood history...this crest compares to a previous crest of 16.1
feet on Oct 9 2016.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive through flooded areas...the water may be much deeper
than you think.

Listen to noaa weather radio or your favorite media outlet for later
statements or warnings.
